titleStmt.title: The good fellows frolick, or, Kent street clubb. Good people all come mind my merry tale, and you shall hear the vertue of good ale, whose charming power some mens humors (hitts, it robs them of their money & their witts: for he in time will surely money lack that minds his belly better than his back. Tune of, Hey boys up go we, Seamans mournful bride, or The fair one let me in.
titleStmt.author: Lanfiere, Thomas.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J. Coniers in Duck-Lane,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "Here is a crew of jovial blades ..."
